decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of the original permission, 00248/117-119/P10 dated 09/12/2015.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (11686/2/12 Rev F2 and 11686/2/13 Rev F2 received: 30/01/2018.
Plans approved under 00248/117-119/P10 as varied by Appeal APP/F5540/W/16/3144162 dated 18/07/2016: 11686/2/12 Rev E, 11686/2/13 Rev E, 11686/3/12 Rev B, and 11686/3/13 Rev A received: 17/09/2015. 11686/2/11 Rev D and 11686/3/11 Rev C received: 22/10/2015) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.
Condition : 3 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the extension hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building.

Condition : 4 - No additional windows or other glazed openings shall be formed in the flank walls of the extension hereby approved and no additional doors inserted in the building without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 5 - No demolition or construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of 8:00am  to 6:00pm on Mondays to Friday and 9:00am to 1:00pm on Saturdays and none shall take place on Sundays and Public Holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority.
Condition : 6 - The basement shall not be converted to a separate dwelling, and the basement shall not be used for sleeping accommodation.

Condition : 7 - No development shall be carried out until such time as the person carrying out the work is a member of the Considerate Constructors Scheme and its code of practice, and the details of the membership and contact details are clearly displayed on the site so that they can be easily read by members of the public.

Condition : 8 - No excavation or construction work relating to the basement extension shall be undertaken prior to the submission and approval in writing by the Local Planning Authority, of a Construction Method Statement, which is certified by a qualified professional giving details of excavation, temporary works and construction techniques, including details of potential impacts on neighbouring land based on assessment of the geology and hydrology of the area.
Condition : 9 - The roof lights shall be 'conservation style', installed to be flush with the existing roof slope.

Condition : 10 - The access doorway to the ground floor A1 unit shall have a minimum clear width of 900mm, a level surface or ramp between the pavement and the floor and a door handle of not more than 1m above ground level.
Condition : 11 - The glazed balustrades to the first floor balcony and second floor roof terrace hall be obscure glazed, and shall not be repaired or replaced otherwise than with obscured glazing.

Condition : 12 - The third floor roof area of the three storey rear extension hereby permitted shall not be used as a balcony, roof garden or similar amenity area without the grant of further specific permission from the Local Planning Authority.
description: Variation of Condition 2 (approved plans) to allow the addition of two rear roof lights to the main roof slope, enlargement of approved roof dormer and replacement of rear dormer window with Juliet balcony, increase height of second floor rear extension and alterations to approved roof fenestration of planning permission 00248/117-119/P10 varied by appeal APP/F5540/W/16/3144162 approved 18/07/2016 for Conversion of upper floors to two self-contained flats (2 x 2-bed) involving erection of three storey rear extension, excavation of basement, raising ridge height, rear dormer window and shopfront alterations.
